articles.headline: What’s a Pound of Prevention Really Worth?
articles.snippet: Preventive medicine just doesn’t pay in the current American medical system.
articles.abstract: Preventive medicine just doesn’t pay in the current American medical system.
articles.lead_paragraph: Arthur Agatston, the South Beach diet doctor, came to town last week and, in between bites of filleted fish, he was trying to persuade me that his patients rarely have heart attacks anymore.

articles.headline: Libby Defense Portrays Client as a Scapegoat
articles.snippet: I. Lewis Libby Jr.’s lawyer asserted that Mr. Libby was made a scapegoat by White House officials to protect Karl Rove.
articles.abstract: I. Lewis Libby Jr.’s lawyer asserted that Mr. Libby was made a scapegoat by White House officials to protect Karl Rove.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23  I. Lewis Libby Jr., the vice president’s former chief of staff, was made a scapegoat by White House officials to protect the president’s longtime political adviser, Karl Rove, Mr. Libby’s lawyer asserted in his opening statement on Tuesday.

articles.headline: Big Insurer Will Pay 640 Katrina Claims
articles.snippet: The agreement between State Farm Insurance and state officials is expected to jump-start rebuilding along the Mississippi Gulf Coast.
articles.abstract: The agreement between State Farm Insurance and state officials is expected to jump-start rebuilding along the Mississippi Gulf Coast.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a move that is expected to jump-start rebuilding along the Mississippi Gulf Coast, State Farm Insurance said yesterday that it had reached an agreement with state officials to pay hundreds of millions of dollars to owners of homes along the coast that were wrecked by Hurricane Katrina.

articles.headline: Iraq Parliament Finds a Quorum Hard to Come By
articles.snippet: Nearly every session of Iraq’s Parliament since November has been adjourned because of low attendance.
articles.abstract: Nearly every session of Iraq’s Parliament since November has been adjourned because of low attendance.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Jan. 23 — Mahmoud al-Mashhadani, the speaker of Parliament, read a roll call of the 275 elected members with a goal of shaming the no-shows.

articles.headline: Biotech Psoriasis Drugs Hit a Cost Ceiling
articles.snippet: Are biotechnology companies reaching the limits of how much they can charge for their drugs? One sign of that is the sluggish sales of drugs for psoriasis.
articles.abstract: Are biotechnology companies reaching the limits of how much they can charge for their drugs? One sign of that is the sluggish sales of drugs for psoriasis.
articles.lead_paragraph: Are biotechnology companies reaching the limits of how much they can charge for their drugs? One sign of that is the sluggish sales of drugs for psoriasis.

articles.headline: On Snowbound Plains, Grim Fight to Save Calves
articles.snippet: Calving season on the High Plains will be harder and more costly than any year in at least a decade, ranchers and agricultural officials say.
articles.abstract: Calving season on the High Plains will be harder and more costly than any year in at least a decade, ranchers and agricultural officials say.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOWNER, Colo., Jan. 17 — The temperature outside was 10 degrees and falling as calf No. 207, just one hour old, lay on the floor of the warming shed, wheezing and fighting for life.

articles.headline: Reworking the A-List
articles.snippet: Those invited to the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, reflect this year’s theme of a shift in power.
articles.abstract: Those invited to the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, reflect this year’s theme of a shift in power.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAVOS, Switzerland, Jan. 23 — The World Economic Forum convenes its annual conference here Wednesday with the theme “Shaping the Global Agenda: The Shifting Power Equation.” To judge by the names on the guest list — and those not on it — the phrase aptly reflects the turnout at this high-altitude huddle.

articles.headline: Murdoch Said to Join Tribune Bid
articles.snippet: Yet another media mogul has reportedly entered the fray for the Tribune Company — Rupert Murdoch and his News Corporation, whose holdings include Fox News and The New York Post.
articles.abstract: Yet another media mogul has reportedly entered the fray for the Tribune Company — Rupert Murdoch and his News Corporation, whose holdings include Fox News and The New York Post.
articles.lead_paragraph: Yet another media mogul has reportedly entered the fray for the Tribune Company — Rupert Murdoch and his News Corporation, whose holdings include Fox News and The New York Post.
articles.byline: By Katharine Q. Seelye and Geraldine Fabrikant
